article.headline: N. Carolina A&amp,T 67, Coppin St. 62
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Tavarus Alston scored 17 points and Robert Johnson added 16 to help North Carolina A&T defeat Coppin State 67-62 on Sunday. The Aggies (7-14, 3-4 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference), who trailed 32-24 at halftime, shot 40.3 percent from the field (21 of 52). Nic Simpson added 13 points for North Carolina A&T, which won for the second time in three games. The Aggies outrebounded Coppin State 37-35, and Johnson, Thomas Coleman and James Porter had six boards each. They were just 6 of 25 from 3-point range (24 percent). Branden Doughty scored 16 points for Coppin State (5-14, 0-7) and Michael Harper added 14. The Eagles, who lost their 11th straight, shot 42.8 percent from the field (24 of 56), and made 33.3 percent of their 3-point shots (8 of 24).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
